title: Auto lockers
body: I think that in normals when the champ select starts you are not allowed to pick your champions after like 10 seconds so that people have to call their lanes then they can select their champions. I don't know I just want a way to stop the people that auto lock before calling their lanes it gets really annoying. Anyone got ideas to stop these auto lockers

replies.body:
Yes and then these people will just wait said 10 seconds and then lock their pick.

Problem totally solved, no holes whatsoever.

Off a cliff?

Until Riot upgrades the client chat decently and can put that into the tribunal (which i might add we still don't have right now), it's unlikely to happen.
I thought the whole point of auto locking/instalocking etc. was in fact to call your lane. It's faster than chat and by the time you lock in, people can't do crap about it.

So we all instalock mid at the same time, then? :)
I never said it was a good thing, or that it wouldn't have any problems associated with it. Because what you said right there is probably the biggest reason I never instalock.
Is team finder noob builder, at all? I looked at it and it seems like it's for people who know what they're doing.
Teambuilder is there to remove auto-locking. Just play Teambuilder, tell everyone else to.
lol i might lmao cuz the game is normal. lol troll with them lmao cuz breaking the meta can some time be op and fun

It's an idea, but it will never fully fix the problems.

And also, I doubt that Riot would do anything about it. I doubt that when the idea of League of Legends came into the developers minds they thought of it as people will play a set lane that they chose earlier. It just worked out that way because people realised that it is the best way of doing things. I don't think it's a bad idea, but I don't think its ever going to happen.
From my normal game's experience, players don't even talk at all and still lock into a lane that they want to play without telling others about it. :

This is never going to be *fully stoppable*, I believe that, **riot** should put in a force chat feature or something along those lines to sort of deter the *auto pickers*, but I think in the end just reporting them after the match to **tribunal **for failing to communicate would be the best way to go about it.
